member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType
member.summary: The LineCapType enumeration defines types of line caps to use at the ends of lines that are drawn with graphics pens.
member.remarks: Graphics line caps are specified by objects (section 2.2.1.7).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeFlat
member.summary: Specifies a squared-off line cap. The end of the line MUST be the last point in the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeSquare
member.summary: Specifies a square line cap. The center of the square MUST be located at the last point in the line. The width of the square is the line width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeRound
member.summary: Specifies a circular line cap. The center of the circle MUST be located at the last point in the line. The diameter of the circle is the line width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeTriangle
member.summary: Specifies a triangular line cap. The base of the triangle MUST be located at the last point in the line. The base of the triangle is the line width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeNoAnchor
member.summary: Specifies that the line end is not anchored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeSquareAnchor
member.summary: Specifies that the line end is anchored with a square line cap. The center of the square MUST be located at the last point in the line. The height and width of the square are the line width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeRoundAnchor
member.summary: Specifies that the line end is anchored with a circular line cap. The center of the circle MUST be located at the last point in the line. The circle SHOULD be wider than the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeDiamondAnchor
member.summary: Specifies that the line end is anchored with a diamond-shaped line cap, which is a square turned at 45 degrees. The center of the diamond MUST be located at the last point in the line. The diamond SHOULD be wider than the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeArrowAnchor
member.summary: Specifies that the line end is anchored with an arrowhead shape. The arrowhead point MUST be located at the last point in the line. The arrowhead SHOULD be wider than the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeAnchorMask
member.summary: Mask used to check whether a line cap is an anchor cap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineCapType.LineCapTypeCustom
member.summary: Specifies a custom line cap.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineJoinType
member.summary: The LineJoinType enumeration defines ways to join two lines that are drawn by the same graphics pen and whose ends meet.
member.remarks: Graphics lines are specified by objects (section 2.2.1.7). A line join makes the intersection of the two line ends look more continuous.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineJoinType.LineJoinTypeMiter
member.summary: Specifies a mitered line join.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineJoinType.LineJoinTypeBevel
member.summary: Specifies a beveled line join.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineJoinType.LineJoinTypeRound
member.summary: Specifies a rounded line join.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineJoinType.LineJoinTypeMiterClipped
member.summary: Specifies a clipped mitered line join.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle
member.summary: The LineStyle enumeration defines styles of lines that are drawn with graphics pens.
member.remarks: Graphics lines are specified by objects (section 2.2.1.7).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle.LineStyleSolid
member.summary: Specifies a solid line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle.LineStyleDash
member.summary: Specifies a dashed line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle.LineStyleDot
member.summary: Specifies a dotted line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle.LineStyleDashDot
member.summary: Specifies an alternating dash-dot line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle.LineStyleDashDotDot
member.summary: Specifies an alternating dash-dot-dot line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusLineStyle.LineStyleCustom
member.summary: Specifies a user-defined, custom dashed line.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusMetafileDataType
member.summary: The MetafileDataType enumeration defines types of metafiles data that can be embedded in an EMF+ metafile.
member.remarks: Embedded metafile data is specified by objects (section 2.2.2.27).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusMetafileDataType.MetafileDataTypeWmf
member.summary: Specifies that the metafile is a WMF metafile that specifies graphics operations with WMF records, as specified in [MS-WMF].

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusMetafileDataType.MetafileDataTypeWmfPlaceable
member.summary: Specifies that the metafile is a WMF metafile that specifies graphics operations with WMF records, and which contains additional header information that makes the WMF metafile device-independent, as specified in [MS-WMF].

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusMetafileDataType.MetafileDataTypeEmf
member.summary: Specifies that the metafile is an EMF metafile that specifies graphics operations with EMF records, as specified in [MS-EMF].

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusMetafileDataType.MetafileDataTypeEmfPlusOnly
member.summary: Specifies that the metafile is an EMF+ metafile that specifies graphics operations with EMF+ records only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusMetafileDataType.MetafileDataTypeEmfPlusDual
member.summary: Specifies that the metafile is an EMF+ metafile that specifies graphics operations with both EMF and EMF+ records.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectClamp
member.summary: EmfPlusObjectClamp specifies the object clamping behavior. It is not used until this object is applied to an image being drawn.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectClamp.RectClamp
member.summary: The rectangle clamp

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectClamp.BitmapClamp
member.summary: The bitmap clamp

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType
member.summary: The ObjectType enumeration defines types of graphics objects that can be created and used in graphics operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeInvalid
member.summary: The object is not a valid object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeBrush
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.1). Brush objects fill graphics regions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypePen
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.7). Pen objects draw graphics lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypePath
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.6). Path objects specify sequences of lines, curves, and shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeRegion
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.8). Region objects specify areas of the output surface.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeImage
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.4). Image objects encapsulate bitmaps and metafiles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeFont
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.3). Font objects specify font properties, including typeface style, EM size, and font family.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeStringFormat
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.9). String format objects specify text layout, including alignment, orientation, tab stops, clipping, and digit substitution for languages that do not use Western European digits.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeImageAttributes
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.5). Image attribute objects specify operations on pixels during image rendering, including color adjustment, grayscale adjustment, gamma correction, and color mapping.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusObjectType.ObjectTypeCustomLineCap
member.summary: Specifies an object (section 2.2.1.2). Custom line cap objects specify shapes to draw at the ends of a graphics line, including squares, circles, and diamonds.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPaletteStyleFlags
member.summary: The PaletteStyle flags specify properties of graphics palettes. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options.
member.remarks: Graphics palettes are specified by objects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPaletteStyleFlags.PaletteStyleHasAlpha
member.summary: If set, one or more of the palette entries MUST contain alpha transparency information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPaletteStyleFlags.PaletteStyleGrayScale
member.summary: If set, the palette MUST contain only grayscale entries.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPaletteStyleFlags.PaletteStyleHalftone
member.summary: If set, the palette MUST contain discrete color values that can be used for halftoning.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointFlags
member.summary: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies how to interpret the points and associated point types that are defined by this object. C (1 bit): If set, the PathPoints array specifies absolute locations in the coordinate space with 16-bit integer coordinates. If clear, the PathPoints array specifies absolute locations in the coordinate space with 32-bit floating-point coordinates. Note If the P flag (below) is set, this flag MAY be clear and MUST be ignored. R (1 bit): If set, the point types in the PathPointTypes array are specified by EmfPlusPathPointTypeRle objects (section 2.2.2.32), which use run-length encoding (RLE) compression, and/or EmfPlusPathPointType objects (section 2.2.2.31). See [MS-WMF] section 3.1.6 for more information on RLE compression. If clear, the point types in the PathPointTypes array are specified by EmfPlusPathPointType objects. P (1 bit): If set, each element in the PathPoints array specifies a location in the coordinate space that is relative to the location specified by the previous element in the array. In the case of the first element in PathPoints, a previous location at coordinates (0,0) is assumed. If clear, each element in the PathPoints array specifies an absolute location.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointFlags.C
member.summary: The c flag

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointFlags.R
member.summary: The r flag

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointFlags.P
member.summary: The p flag

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeEnum
member.summary: The PathPointType enumeration defines types of points on a graphics path.
member.remarks: Graphics path point types are specified by objects (section 2.2.2.31).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeEnum.PathPointTypeStart
member.summary: Specifies that the point is the starting point of a path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeEnum.PathPointTypeLine
member.summary: Specifies that the point is one of the two endpoints of a line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeEnum.PathPointTypeBezier
member.summary: Specifies that the point is an endpoint or control point of a cubic Bezier curve.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeFlags
member.summary: The PathPointType flags specify type properties of points on graphics paths. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options.
member.remarks: Graphics paths are specified by objects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeFlags.PathPointTypeDashMode
member.summary: Specifies that a line segment that passes through the point is dashed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeFlags.PathPointTypePathMarker
member.summary: Specifies that the point is a position marker.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPathPointTypeFlags.PathPointTypeCloseSubpath
member.summary: Specifies that the point is the endpoint of a subpath.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenAlignment
member.summary: The PenAlignment enumeration defines the distribution of the width of the pen with respect to the line being drawn.
member.remarks: Graphics pens are specified by objects (section 2.2.1.7). Pen alignment can be visualized by considering a theoretical one-dimensional line drawn between two specified points. The pen alignment determines the proportion of pen width that is orthogonal to the theoretical line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenAlignment.PenAlignmentCenter
member.summary: Specifies that the EmfPlusPen object is centered over the theoretical line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenAlignment.PenAlignmentInset
member.summary: Specifies that the pen is positioned on the inside of the theoretical line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenAlignment.PenAlignmentLeft
member.summary: Specifies that the pen is positioned to the left of the theoretical line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenAlignment.PenAlignmentOutset
member.summary: Specifies that the pen is positioned on the outside of the theoretical line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenAlignment.PenAlignmentRight
member.summary: Specifies that the pen is positioned to the right of the theoretical line.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags
member.summary: The PenData flags specify properties of graphics pens, including the presence of optional data fields. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options.
member.remarks: Graphics pens are specified by objects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataTransform
member.summary: If set, a 2x3 transform matrix MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataStartCap
member.summary: If set, the style of a starting line cap MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataEndCap
member.summary: Indicates whether the style of an ending line cap MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataJoin
member.summary: Indicates whether a line join type MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataMiterLimit
member.summary: Indicates whether a miter limit MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataLineStyle
member.summary: Indicates whether a line style MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataDashedLineCap
member.summary: Indicates whether a dashed line cap MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataDashedLineOffset
member.summary: Indicates whether a dashed line offset MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataDashedLine
member.summary: Indicates whether an object MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataNonCenter
member.summary: Indicates whether a pen alignment MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataCompoundLine
member.summary: Indicates whether the length and content of a object are present in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataCustomStartCap
member.summary: Indicates whether an object MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPenDataFlags.PenDataCustomEndCap
member.summary: Indicates whether an object MUST be specified in the OptionalData field of an object.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat
member.summary: The PixelFormat enumeration defines pixel formats that are supported in EMF+ bitmaps.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormatUndefined
member.summary: The format is not specified.
member.remarks: Pixel formats are specified by objects. They are encoded as follows: - Bits 0-7: Enumeration of the pixel format constants, starting at zero. - Bits 8-15: The total number of bits per pixel. - Bit 16: If set, the color value is indexed into a palette. - Bit 17: If set, the color value is in a GDI-supported format. - Bit 18: If set, the color value has an alpha component. - Bit 19: If set, the color value has a premultiplied alpha component. - Bit 20: If set, extended colors, 16-bits per channel, are supported. - Bits 21-31: Reserved.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat1bppIndexed
member.summary: The format is monochrome, and a color palette lookup table is used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat4bppIndexed
member.summary: The format is 16-color, and a color palette lookup table is used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat8bppIndexed
member.summary: The format is 256-color, and a color palette lookup table is used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat16bppGrayScale
member.summary: The format is 16 bits per pixel, grayscale.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat16bppRGB555
member.summary: The format is 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components. The remaining bit is not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat16bppRGB565
member.summary: The format is 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits are used for the red component, 6 bits for the green component, and 5 bits for the blue component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat16bppARGB1555
member.summary: The format is 16 bits per pixel; 1 bit is used for the alpha component, and 5 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat24bppRGB
member.summary: The format is 24 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat32bppRGB
member.summary: The format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components. The remaining 8 bits are not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat32bppARGB
member.summary: The format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat32bppPARGB
member.summary: The format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components. The red, green, and blue components are premultiplied according to the alpha component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat48bppRGB
member.summary: The format is 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat64bppARGB
member.summary: The format is 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelFormat.PixelFormat64bppPARGB
member.summary: The format is 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components. The red, green, and blue components are premultiplied according to the alpha component.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelOffsetMode
member.summary: The PixelOffsetMode enumeration defines how pixels are offset, which specifies the trade-off between rendering speed and quality.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelOffsetMode.PixelOffsetModeDefault
member.summary: Pixels are centered on integer coordinates, specifying speed over quality.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelOffsetMode.PixelOffsetModeHighSpeed
member.summary: Pixels are centered on integer coordinates, as with PixelOffsetModeNone. Higher speed at the expense of quality is specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelOffsetMode.PixelOffsetModeHighQuality
member.summary: Pixels are centered on half-integer coordinates, as with PixelOffsetModeHalf. Higher quality at the expense of speed is specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelOffsetMode.PixelOffsetModeNone
member.summary: Pixels are centered on the origin, which means that the pixel covers the area from -0.5 to 0.5 on both the x and y axes and its center is at (0,0).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusPixelOffsetMode.PixelOffsetModeHalf
member.summary: Pixels are centered on half-integer coordinates, which means that the pixel covers the area from 0 to 1 on both the x and y axes and its center is at (0.5,0.5). By offsetting pixels during rendering, the render quality can be improved at the cost of render speed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType
member.summary: The RecordType enumeration defines record types used in EMF+ metafiles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusHeader
member.summary: This record specifies the start of EMF+ data in the metafile. It MUST be embedded in the first EMF record after the record ([MS-EMF] section 2.3.4.2 record).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusEndOfFile
member.summary: This record specifies the end of EMF+ data in the metafile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusComment
member.summary: This record specifies arbitrary private data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusGetDC
member.summary: This record specifies that subsequent EMF records encountered in the metafile SHOULD be processed. EMF records cease being processed when the next EMF+ record is encountered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusMultiFormatStart
member.summary: This record is reserved and MUST NOT be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusMultiFormatSection
member.summary: This record is reserved and MUST NOT be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusMultiFormatEnd
member.summary: This record is reserved and MUST NOT be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusObject
member.summary: This record specifies an object for use in graphics operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusClear
member.summary: This record clears the output coordinate space and initializes it with a specified background color and transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillRects
member.summary: This record defines how to fill the interiors of a series of rectangles, using a specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawRects
member.summary: This record defines the pen strokes for drawing a series of rectangles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillPolygon
member.summary: This record defines the data to fill the interior of a polygon, using a specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawLines
member.summary: This record defines the pen strokes for drawing a series of connected lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillEllipse
member.summary: This record defines how to fill the interiors of an ellipse, using a specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawEllipse
member.summary: This record defines the pen strokes for drawing an ellipse.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillPie
member.summary: This record defines how to fill a section of an interior section of an ellipse using a specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawPie
member.summary: This record defines pen strokes for drawing a section of an ellipse.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawArc
member.summary: The record defines pen strokes for drawing an arc of an ellipse.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillRegion
member.summary: This record defines how to fill the interior of a region using a specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillPath
member.summary: The record defines how to fill the interiors of the figures defined in a graphics path with a specified brush. A path is an object that defines an arbitrary sequence of lines, curves, and shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawPath
member.summary: The record defines the pen strokes to draw the figures in a graphics path. A path is an object that defines an arbitrary sequence of lines, curves, and shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusFillClosedCurve
member.summary: This record defines how to fill the interior of a closed cardinal spline using a specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawClosedCurve
member.summary: This record defines the pen and strokes for drawing a closed cardinal spline.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawCurve
member.summary: This record defines the pen strokes for drawing a cardinal spline.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawBeziers
member.summary: This record defines the pen strokes for drawing a Bezier spline.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawImage
member.summary: This record defines a scaled object (section 2.2.1.4). An image can consist of either bitmap or metafile data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawImagePoints
member.summary: This record defines a scaled EmfPlusImage object inside a parallelogram. An image can consist of either bitmap or metafile data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawString
member.summary: This record defines a text string based on a font, a layout rectangle, and a format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetRenderingOrigin
member.summary: This record defines the origin of rendering to the specified horizontal and vertical coordinates. This applies to hatch brushes and to 8 and 16 bits per pixel dither patterns.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetAntiAliasMode
member.summary: This record defines whether to enable or disable text anti-aliasing. Text anti-aliasing is a method of making lines and edges of character glyphs appear smoother when drawn on an output surface.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetTextRenderingHint
member.summary: This record defines the process used for rendering text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetTextContrast
member.summary: This record sets text contrast according to the specified text gamma value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetInterpolationMode
member.summary: This record defines the interpolation mode of an object according to the specified type of image filtering. The interpolation mode influences how scaling (stretching and shrinking) is performed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetPixelOffsetMode
member.summary: This record defines the pixel offset mode according to the specified pixel centering value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetCompositingMode
member.summary: This record defines the compositing mode according to the state of alpha blending, which specifies how source colors are combined with background colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetCompositingQuality
member.summary: This record defines the compositing quality, which describes the desired level of quality for creating composite images from multiple objects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSave
member.summary: This record saves the graphics state, identified by a specified index, on a stack of saved graphics states. Each stack index is associated with a particular saved state, and the index is used by an record (section 2.3.7.4) to restore the state.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusRestore
member.summary: This record restores the graphics state, identified by a specified index, from a stack of saved graphics states. Each stack index is associated with a particular saved state, and the index is defined by an record (section 2.3.7.5) to save the state.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusBeginContainer
member.summary: This record opens a new graphics state container and specifies a transform for it. Graphics containers are used to retain elements of the graphics state.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusBeginContainerNoParams
member.summary: This record opens a new graphics state container.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusEndContainer
member.summary: This record closes a graphics state container that was previously opened by a begin container operation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetWorldTransform
member.summary: This record defines the current world space transform in the playback device_context, according to a specified transform matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusResetWorldTransform
member.summary: This record resets the current world space transform to the identify matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusMultiplyWorldTransform
member.summary: This record multiplies the current world space by a specified transform matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusTranslateWorldTransform
member.summary: This record applies a translation transform to the current world space by specified horizontal and vertical distances.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusScaleWorldTransform
member.summary: This record applies a scaling transform to the current world space by specified horizontal and vertical scale factors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusRotateWorldTransform
member.summary: This record rotates the current world space by a specified angle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetPageTransform
member.summary: This record specifies extra scaling factors for the current world space transform.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusResetClip
member.summary: This record resets the current clipping region for the world space to infinity.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetClipRect
member.summary: This record combines the current clipping region with a rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetClipPath
member.summary: This record combines the current clipping region with a graphics path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetClipRegion
member.summary: This record combines the current clipping region with another graphics region.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusOffsetClip
member.summary: This record applies a translation transform on the current clipping region of the world space.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusDrawDriverString
member.summary: This record specifies text output with character positions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusStrokeFillPath
member.summary: This record closes any open figures in a path, strokes the outline of the path by using the current pen, and fills its interior by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSerializableObject
member.summary: This record defines an image effects parameter block that has been serialized into a data buffer.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetTSGraphics
member.summary: This record specifies the state of a graphics device context for a terminal server.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRecordType.EmfPlusSetTSClip
member.summary: This record specifies clipping areas in the graphics device context for a terminal server.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType
member.summary: The RegionNodeDataType enumeration defines types of region node data.
member.remarks: Region node data is specified by objects (section 2.2.2.40).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeAnd
member.summary: Specifies a region node with child nodes. A Boolean AND operation SHOULD be applied to the left and right child nodes specified by an object (section 2.2.2.41).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeOr
member.summary: Specifies a region node with child nodes. A Boolean OR operation SHOULD be applied to the left and right child nodes specified by an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeXor
member.summary: Specifies a region node with child nodes. A Boolean XOR operation SHOULD be applied to the left and right child nodes specified by an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeExclude
member.summary: Specifies a region node with child nodes. A Boolean operation, defined as "the part of region 1 that is excluded from region 2", SHOULD be applied to the left and right child nodes specified by an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeComplement
member.summary: Specifies a region node with child nodes. A Boolean operation, defined as "the part of region 2 that is excluded from region 1", SHOULD be applied to the left and right child nodes specified by an object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeRect
member.summary: Specifies a region node with no child nodes. The RegionNodeData field SHOULD specify a boundary with an object (section 2.2.2.39).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypePath
member.summary: Specifies a region node with no child nodes. The RegionNodeData field SHOULD specify a boundary with an object (section 2.2.2.42).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeEmpty
member.summary: Specifies a region node with no child nodes. The RegionNodeData field SHOULD NOT be present

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusRegionNodeDataType.RegionNodeDataTypeInfinite
member.summary: Specifies a region node with no child nodes, and its bounds are not defined.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode
member.summary: The SmoothingMode enumeration defines smoothing modes to apply to lines, curves, and the edges of filled areas to make them appear more continuous or sharply defined.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode.SmoothingModeDefault
member.summary: Specifies default curve smoothing with no anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode.SmoothingModeHighSpeed
member.summary: Specifies best performance with no anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode.SmoothingModeHighQuality
member.summary: Specifies best quality with anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode.SmoothingModeNone
member.summary: Performs no curve smoothing and no anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode.SmoothingModeAntiAlias8x4
member.summary: Specifies good quality using an 8x4 box filter.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusSmoothingMode.SmoothingModeAntiAlias8x8
member.summary: Specifies better quality using an 8x8 box filter.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringAlignment
member.summary: The StringAlignment enumeration defines ways to align strings with respect to a text layout rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringAlignment.StringAlignmentNear
member.summary: Specifies that string alignment is toward the origin of the layout rectangle. This can be used to align characters along a line or to align text within a rectangle. For a right-to-left layout rectangle, the origin SHOULD be at the upper right.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringAlignment.StringAlignmentCenter
member.summary: Specifies that alignment is centered between the origin and extent of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringAlignment.StringAlignmentFar
member.summary: Specifies that alignment is to the right side of the layout rectangle.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringDigitSubstitution
member.summary: The StringDigitSubstitution enumeration defines ways to substitute digits in a string according to a user's locale or language.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringDigitSubstitution.StringDigitSubstitutionUser
member.summary: Specifies an implementation-defined substitution scheme.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringDigitSubstitution.StringDigitSubstitutionNone
member.summary: Specifies to disable substitutions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringDigitSubstitution.StringDigitSubstitutionNational
member.summary: Specifies substitution digits that correspond with the official national language of the user's locale.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringDigitSubstitution.StringDigitSubstitutionTraditional
member.summary: Specifies substitution digits that correspond to the user's native script or language, which can be different from the official national language of the user's locale.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags
member.summary: The StringFormat flags specify options for graphics text layout, including direction, clipping and font handling. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatDirectionRightToLeft
member.summary: If set, the reading order of the string SHOULD be right to left. For horizontal text, this means that characters are read from right to left. For vertical text, this means that columns are read from right to left. If clear, horizontal or vertical text SHOULD be read from left to right.
member.remarks: Graphics text layout is specified by objects

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatDirectionVertical
member.summary: If set, individual lines of text SHOULD be drawn vertically on the display device. If clear, individual lines of text SHOULD be drawn horizontally, with each new line below the previous line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatNoFitBlackBox
member.summary: If set, parts of characters MUST be allowed to overhang the text layout rectangle. If clear, characters that overhang the boundaries of the text layout rectangle MUST be repositioned to avoid overhang. An italic, "f" is an example of a character that can have overhanging parts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatDisplayFormatControl
member.summary: If set, control characters SHOULD appear in the output as representative Unicode glyphs.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatNoFontFallback
member.summary: If set, an alternate font SHOULD be used for characters that are not supported in the requested font. If clear, a character missing from the requested font SHOULD appear as a "font missing" character, which MAY be an open square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatMeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: If set, the space at the end of each line MUST be included in measurements of string length. If clear, the space at the end of each line MUST be excluded from measurements of string length.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatNoWrap
member.summary: If set, a string that extends past the end of the text layout rectangle MUST NOT be wrapped to the next line. If clear, a string that extends past the end of the text layout rectangle MUST be broken at the last word boundary within the bounding rectangle, and the remainder of the string MUST be wrapped to the next line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatLineLimit
member.summary: If set, whole lines of text SHOULD be output and SHOULD NOT be clipped by the string's layout rectangle. If clear, text layout SHOULD continue until all lines are output, or until additional lines would not be visible as a result of clipping. This flag can be used either to deny or allow a line of text to be partially obscured by a layout rectangle that is not a multiple of line height. For all text to be visible, a layout rectangle at least as tall as the height of one line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatNoClip
member.summary: If set, text extending outside the string layout rectangle SHOULD be allowed to show. If clear, all text that extends outside the layout rectangle SHOULD be clipped.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringFormatFlags.StringFormatBypassGdi
member.summary: This flag MAY be used to specify an implementation-specific process for rendering text.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming
member.summary: The StringTrimming enumeration defines how to trim characters from a string that is too large for the text layout rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming.StringTrimmingNone
member.summary: Specifies that no trimming is done.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming.StringTrimmingCharacter
member.summary: Specifies that the string is broken at the boundary of the last character that is inside the layout rectangle. This is the default.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming.StringTrimmingWord
member.summary: Specifies that the string is broken at the boundary of the last word that is inside the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming.StringTrimmingEllipsisCharacter
member.summary: Specifies that the string is broken at the boundary of the last character that is inside the layout rectangle, and an ellipsis (...) is inserted after the character.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming.StringTrimmingEllipsisWord
member.summary: Specifies that the string is broken at the boundary of the last word that is inside the layout rectangle, and an ellipsis (...) is inserted after the word.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusStringTrimming.StringTrimmingEllipsisPath
member.summary: Specifies that the center is removed from the string and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last portion of the string as possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint
member.summary: The TextRenderingHint enumeration defines types of text hinting and anti-aliasing, which affects the quality of text rendering.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintSystemDefault
member.summary: Specifies that each text character SHOULD be drawn using whatever font-smoothing settings have been configured on the operating system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintSingleBitPerPixelGridFit
member.summary: Specifies that each text character SHOULD be drawn using its glyph bitmap. Smoothing MAY be used to improve the appearance of character glyph stems and curvature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintSingleBitPerPixel
member.summary: Specifies that each text character SHOULD be drawn using its glyph bitmap. Smoothing is not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintAntialiasGridFit
member.summary: Specifies that each text character SHOULD be drawn using its anti-aliased glyph bitmap with smoothing. The rendering is high quality because of anti-aliasing, but at a higher performance cost.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintAntialias
member.summary: Specifies that each text character is drawn using its anti-aliased glyph bitmap without hinting. Better quality results from anti-aliasing, but stem width differences MAY be noticeable because hinting is turned off.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusTextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintClearTypeGridFit
member.summary: Specifies that each text character SHOULD be drawn using its ClearType glyph bitmap with smoothing. This is the highest-quality text hinting setting, which is used to take advantage of ClearType font features.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType
member.summary: The UnitType enumeration defines units of measurement in different coordinate systems.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypeWorld
member.summary: Specifies a unit of logical distance within the world space.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypeDisplay
member.summary: Specifies a unit of distance based on the characteristics of the physical display. For example, if the display device is a monitor, then the unit is 1 pixel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypePixel
member.summary: Specifies a unit of 1 pixel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypePoint
member.summary: Specifies a unit of 1 printer's point, or 1/72 inch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypeInch
member.summary: Specifies a unit of 1 inch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypeDocument
member.summary: Specifies a unit of 1/300 inch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusUnitType.UnitTypeMillimeter
member.summary: Specifies a unit of 1 millimeter.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusWrapMode
member.summary: The WrapMode enumeration defines how the pattern from a texture or gradient brush is tiled across a shape or at shape boundaries, when it is smaller than the area being filled.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusWrapMode.WrapModeTile
member.summary: Tiles the gradient or texture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusWrapMode.WrapModeTileFlipX
member.summary: Reverses the texture or gradient horizontally, and then tiles the texture or gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusWrapMode.WrapModeTileFlipY
member.summary: Reverses the texture or gradient vertically, and then tiles the texture or gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusWrapMode.WrapModeTileFlipXY
member.summary: Reverses the texture or gradient horizontally and vertically, and then tiles the texture or gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Consts.EmfPlusWrapMode.WrapModeClamp
member.summary: Fixes the texture or gradient to the object boundary.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBaseBitmapData
member.summary: Base class for bitmap data types.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusStructureObjectType
member.summary: The Structure Objects specify containers for data structures that are embedded in EMF+ metafile records.Structure objects, unlike graphics objects, are not explicitly created; they are components that make up more complex structures

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusObject
member.summary: Base Emf+ object type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBaseBrushData
member.summary: Base class for Brush data types.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBaseImageData
member.summary: Base class for image data types.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBasePointType
member.summary: The base point type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap
member.summary: The EmfPlusBitmap object specifies a bitmap that contains a graphics image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap.BitmapData
member.summary: Gets or sets bitmap data BitmapData (variable): Variable-length data that defines the bitmap data object specified in the Type field. The content and format of the data can be different for every bitmap type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets bitmap height Height (4 bytes): A 32-bit signed integer that specifies the height in pixels of the area occupied by the bitmap. If the image is compressed, according to the Type field, this value is undefined and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap.PixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets pixel format PixelFormat (4 bytes): A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the format of the pixels that make up the bitmap image. The supported pixel formats are specified in the enumeration (section 2.1.1.25). If the image is compressed, according to the Type field, this value is undefined and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap.Stride
member.summary: Gets or sets stride of the image Stride (4 bytes): A 32-bit signed integer that specifies the byte offset between the beginning of one scan-line and the next. This value is the number of bytes per pixel, which is specified in the PixelFormat field, multiplied by the width in pixels, which is specified in the Width field. The value of this field MUST be a multiple of four. If the image is compressed, according to the Type field, this value is undefined and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets type of the image Type (4 bytes): A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the type of data in the BitmapData field. This value MUST be defined in the enumeration (section 2.1.1.2).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmap.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets image Width Width (4 bytes): A 32-bit signed integer that specifies the width in pixels of the area occupied by the bitmap. If the image is compressed, according to the Type field, this value is undefined and MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmapData
member.summary: The EmfPlusBitmapData object specifies a bitmap image with pixel data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmapData.Colors
member.summary: Gets or sets the palette colors Colors (variable): An optional object (section 2.2.2.28), which specifies the palette of colors used in the pixel data. This field MUST be present if the I flag is set in the PixelFormat field of the object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBitmapData.PixelData
member.summary: Gets or sets pixel data PixelData (variable): An array of bytes that specify the pixel data. The size and format of this data can be computed from fields in the EmfPlusBitmap object, including the pixel format from the enumeration (section 2.1.1.25).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendBase
member.summary: Base object for blend objects

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendBase.BlendPositions
member.summary: Gets or sets blend positions An array of PositionCount 32-bit floating-point values that specify proportions of distance along the gradient line. Each element MUST be a number between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive. For a linear gradient brush, 0.0 represents the starting point and 1.0 represents the ending point. For a path gradient brush, 0.0 represents the midpoint and 1.0 represents an endpoint

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendBase.PositionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets positions count A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of positions in the BlendPositions field and colors in the BlendColors field

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendColors
member.summary: The EmfPlusBlendColors object specifies positions and colors for the blend pattern of a gradient brush.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendColors.BlendArgb32Colors
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of PositionCount EmfPlusARGB objects (section 2.2.2.1) that specify colors at the positions defined in the BlendPositions field.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendFactors
member.summary: The EmfPlusBlendFactors object specifies positions and factors for the blend pattern of a gradient brush.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlendFactors.BlendFactors
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of PositionCount 32-bit floating point values that specify proportions of colors at the positions defined in the BlendPositions field. Each value MUST be a number between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlurEffect
member.summary: The BlurEffect object specifies a decrease in the difference in intensity between pixels in an image.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusImageEffectsObjectType
member.summary: The Image Effects Objects specify parameters for graphics image effects, which can be applied to bitmap images

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlurEffect.BlurRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit floating-point number that specifies the blur radius in pixels, which determines the number of pixels involved in calculating the new value of a given pixel. This value MUST be in the range 0.0 through 255.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBlurEffect.ExpandEdge
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit Boolean value that specifies whether the bitmap expands by an amount equal to the value of the BlurRadius to produce soft edges. This value MUST be one of the following: FALSE 0x00000000 The size of the bitmap MUST NOT change, and its soft edges SHOULD be clipped to the size of the BlurRadius. TRUE 0x00000001 The size of the bitmap SHOULD expand by an amount equal to the BlurRadius to produce soft edges.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryBase
member.summary: Base class for boundary objects

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryPathData
member.summary: The EmfPlusBoundaryPathData object specifies a graphics path boundary for a gradient brush.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryPathData.BoundaryPathData
member.summary: Gets or sets an EmfPlusPath object (section 2.2.1.6) that specifies the boundary of the brush

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryPathData.BoundaryPathSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the size in bytes of the BoundaryPathData field.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryPointData
member.summary: The EmfPlusBoundaryPointData object specifies a closed cardinal spline boundary for a gradient brush

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryPointData.BoundaryPointCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the number of points in the BoundaryPointData field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBoundaryPointData.BoundaryPointData
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of BoundaryPointCount EmfPlusPointF objects that specify the boundary of the brush.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBrightnessContrastEffect
member.summary: The BrightnessContrastEffect object specifies an expansion or contraction of the lightest and darkest areas of an image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBrightnessContrastEffect.BrightnessLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the brightness level. This value MUST be in the range -255 through 255, with effects as follows: -255 value < 0 As the value decreases, the brightness of the image SHOULD decrease. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the brightness MUST NOT change. 0 < value 255 As the value increases, the brightness of the image SHOULD increase.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBrightnessContrastEffect.ContrastLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the contrast level. This value MUST be in the range -100 through 100, with effects as follows: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the contrast of the image SHOULD decrease. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the contrast MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the contrast of the image SHOULD increase.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBrush
member.summary: The EmfPlusBrush object specifies a graphics brush for filling regions.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusGraphicsObjectType
member.summary: The Graphics Objects specify parameters for graphics output. They are part of the playback device context and are persistent during the playback of an EMF+ metafile.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusGraphicsObjectType.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version.
member.value: An object (section 2.2.2.19) that specifies the version of operating system graphics that was used to create this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBrush.BrushData
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush data Variable-length data that defines the brush object specified in the Type field. The content and format of the data can be different for every brush type. EmfPlusHatchBrushData (section 2.2.2.20) (done) EmfPlusLinearGradientBrushData object (section 2.2.2.24) (done) EmfPlusPathGradientBrushData object (section 2.2.2.29) (done) EmfPlusSolidBrushData object (section 2.2.2.43) (done) EmfPlusTextureBrushData object (section 2.2.2.45) (done)

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusBrush.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the type of brush, which determines the contents of the BrushData field. This value MUST be defined in the enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusCharacterRange
member.summary: EmfPlusCharacterRange description

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusCharacterRange.First
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the first position of this range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusCharacterRange.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the number of positions in this range

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorBalanceEffect
member.summary: The ColorBalanceEffect object specifies adjustments to the relative amounts of red, green, and blue in an image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorBalanceEffect.CyanRed
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies a change in the amount of red in the image. This value MUST be in the range -100 through 100, with effects as follows: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the amount of red in the image SHOULD decrease and the amount of cyan SHOULD increase. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the amounts of red and cyan MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the amount of red in the image SHOULD increase and the amount of cyan SHOULD decrease.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorBalanceEffect.MagentaGreen
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies a change in the amount of green in the image. This value MUST be in the range -100 through 100, with effects as follows: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the amount of green in the image SHOULD decrease and the amount of magenta SHOULD increase. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the amounts of green and magenta MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the amount of green in the image SHOULD increase and the amount of magenta SHOULD decrease.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorBalanceEffect.YellowBlue
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies a change in the amount of blue in the image. This value MUST be in the range -100 through 100, with effects as follows: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the amount of blue in the image SHOULD decrease and the amount of yellow SHOULD increase. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the amounts of blue and yellow MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the amount of blue in the image SHOULD increase and the amount of yellow SHOULD decrease.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorCurveEffect
member.summary: The ColorCurveEffect object specifies one of eight adjustments to the color curve of an image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorCurveEffect.CurveAdjustment
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the curve adjustment to apply to the colors in bitmap. This value MUST be defined in the CurveAdjustments enumeration (section 2.1.1.7).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorCurveEffect.CurveChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the color channel to which the curve adjustment applies. This value MUST be defined in the CurveChannel enumeration (section 2.1.1.8).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorCurveEffect.AdjustmentIntensity
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the intensity of the curve adjustment to the color channel specified by CurveChannel. The ranges of meaningful values for this field vary according to the CurveAdjustment value, as follows: Exposure adjustment range: -255 value < 0 As the value decreases, the exposure of the image SHOULD decrease. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the exposure MUST NOT change. 0 < value 255 As the value increases, the exposure of the image SHOULD increase. Density adjustment range: -255 value < 0 As the value decreases, the density of the image SHOULD decrease, resulting in a darker image. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the density MUST NOT change. 0 < value 255 As the value increases, the density of the image SHOULD increase. Contrast adjustment range: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the contrast of the image SHOULD decrease. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the contrast MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the contrast of the image SHOULD increase. Highlight adjustment range: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the light areas of the image SHOULD appear darker. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the highlight MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the light areas of the image SHOULD appear lighter. Shadow adjustment range: -100 value < 0 As the value decreases, the dark areas of the image SHOULD appear darker. 0 A value of 0 specifies that the shadow MUST NOT change. 0 < value 100 As the value increases, the dark areas of the image SHOULD appear lighter. White saturation adjustment range: 0 255 As the value increases, the upper limit of the range of color channel intensities increases. Black saturation adjustment range: 0 255 As the value increases, the lower limit of the range of color channel intensities increases.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorLookupTableEffect
member.summary: The ColorLookupTableEffect object specifies adjustments to the colors in an image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorLookupTableEffect.BlueLookupTable
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the blue color channel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorLookupTableEffect.GreenLookupTable
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the green color channel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorLookupTableEffect.RedLookupTable
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the red color channel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorLookupTableEffect.AlphaLookupTable
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of 256 bytes that specifies the adjustment for the alpha color channel.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect
member.summary: The ColorMatrixEffect object specifies an affine transform to be applied to an image.
member.remarks: Bitmap images are specified by EmfPlusBitmap objects (section 2.2.2.2). A color matrix effect is performed by multiplying a color vector by a ColorMatrixEffect object. A 5x5 color matrix can perform a linear transform, including reflection, rotation, shearing, or scaling followed by a translation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect.MatrixN0
member.summary: Gets or sets the Matrix[N][0] of the 5x5 color matrix. This row is used for transforms.
member.remarks: Matrix_0_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[0][0], which is the factor for the color red. Matrix_1_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[1][0]. Matrix_2_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[2][0]. Matrix_3_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[3][0]. Matrix_4_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[4][0]. This value MUST be 0.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect.MatrixN1
member.summary: Gets or sets the Matrix[N][1] of the 5x5 color matrix. This row is used for transforms.
member.remarks: Matrix_0_1 (4 bytes): Matrix[0][1]. Matrix_1_1 (4 bytes): Matrix[1][1], which is the factor for the color green. Matrix_2_1 (4 bytes): Matrix[2][1]. Matrix_3_1 (4 bytes): Matrix[3][1]. Matrix_4_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[4][0]. This value MUST be 0.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect.MatrixN2
member.summary: Gets or sets the Matrix[N][2] of the 5x5 color matrix. This row is used for transforms.
member.remarks: Matrix_0_2 (4 bytes): Matrix[0][2]. Matrix_1_2 (4 bytes): Matrix[1][2]. Matrix_2_2 (4 bytes): Matrix[2][2], which is the factor for the color blue. Matrix_3_1 (4 bytes): Matrix[3][1]. Matrix_4_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[4][0]. This value MUST be 0.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect.MatrixN3
member.summary: Gets or sets the Matrix[N][3] of the 5x5 color matrix. This row is used for transforms.
member.remarks: Matrix_0_3 (4 bytes): Matrix[0][3]. Matrix_1_3 (4 bytes): Matrix[1][3]. Matrix_2_3 (4 bytes): Matrix[2][3]. Matrix_3_3 (4 bytes): Matrix[3][3], which is the factor for the alpha (transparency) Matrix_4_0 (4 bytes): Matrix[4][0]. This value MUST be 0.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect.MatrixN4
member.summary: Gets or sets the Matrix[N][4] of the 5x5 color matrix. This row is used for color translations.
member.remarks: Matrix_0_4 (4 bytes): Matrix[0][4]. Matrix_1_4 (4 bytes): Matrix[1][4]. Matrix_2_4 (4 bytes): Matrix[2][4]. Matrix_3_4 (4 bytes): Matrix[3][4]. Matrix_4_4 (4 bytes): Matrix[4][4]. This value SHOULD be 1.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusColorMatrixEffect.Matrix
member.summary: Gets or sets the matrix.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusCompoundLineData

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of CompoundLineDataSize floating-point values that specify the compound line of a pen. The elements MUST be in increasing order, and their values MUST be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.EmfPlus.Objects.EmfPlusCompoundLineData.CompoundLineDataSize

member.summary: The EmfPlusCompressedImage object specifies an image with compressed data.
