member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader
member.summary: The EMR_HEADER record types define the starting points of EMF metafiles and specify properties of the device on which the image in the metafile was created. The information in the header record makes it possible for EMF metafiles to be independent of any specific output device. The value of the Size field can be used to distinguish between the different EMR_HEADER record types listed earlier in this section. There are three possible headers: The base header, which is the EmfMetafileHeader record. The fixed-size part of this header is 88 bytes, and it contains a Header object. The first extension header, which is the EmfMetafileHeaderExtension1 record. The fixed-size part of this header is 100 bytes, and it contains a Header object and a HeaderExtension1 object (section 2.2.10). The second extension header, which is the EmfMetafileHeaderExtension2 record. The fixed-size part of this header is 108 bytes, and it contains a Header object, a HeaderExtension1 object, and a HeaderExtension2 object (section 2.2.11).

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader.EmfHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a Header object (section 2.2.9), which contains information about the content and structure of the metafile

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader.EmfHeaderRecordBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional array of bytes that contains the remainder of the EMF header record. The size of this field MUST be a multiple of 4 bytes

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader.EmfDescriptionBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the EMF description buffer An optional array of bytes that contains the EMF description string, which is not required to be contiguous with the fixed portion of the EmfMetafileHeader record. Accordingly, the field in this buffer that is labeled "UndefinedSpace" is optional and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeader.EmfDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the EMF description An optional, null-terminated Unicode UTF16-LE string of arbitrary length and content. Its location in the record and number of characters are specified by the offDescription and nDescription fields, respectively, in EmfHeader. If the value of either field is zero, no description string is present.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeaderExtension1
member.summary: The EmfMetafileHeaderExtension1 record is the header record used in the first extension to EMF metafiles. Following the EmfHeaderExtension1 field, the remaining fields are optional and can be present in any order.

member.summary: Gets or sets a HeaderExtension1 object, which specifies additional information about the image in the metafile.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfMetafileHeaderExtension1.EmfPixelFormatBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional array of bytes that contains the EMF pixel format descriptor, which is not required to be contiguous with the fixed portion of the EmfMetafileHeaderExtension1 record or with the EMF description string. Accordingly, the field in this buffer that is labeled "UndefinedSpace" is optional and MUST be ignored

member.remarks: For more information concerning transforms and coordinate spaces, see [MSDN-WRLDPGSPC]. See section 2.3.12 for the specification of other transform record types.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfNamedEscape.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets The data to pass to the printer driver. There MUST be cjIn bytes available.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 64-bit WMF PointL objects, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.15, which specifies the coordinates, in logical units, of the endpoint of the first radial.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPie.End

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt
member.summary: The EMR_PLGBLT record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination parallelogram, with the application of a color mask bitmap.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF RectL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19) that defines the bounding rectangle, in device units, for output to the destination.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.AptlDest
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of three WMF PointL objects ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.15) that specifies three corners a parallelogram destination area for the block transfer. The upper-left corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the first point in this array, the upper-right corner to the second point, and the lower-left corner to the third point. The lower-right corner of the source rectangle is mapped to the implicit fourth point in the parallelogram, which is computed from the first three points (A, B, and C) by treating them as vectors. D = B + C A

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.XSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.YSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.CxSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical width of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.CySrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical height of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.XFormSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets an XForm object (section 2.2.28) that specifies a world-space to page-space transform to apply to the source bitmap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.BkSrcArgb32Color
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF ColorRef object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8) that specifies the background color of the source bitmap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.UsageSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies how to interpret values in the color table in the source bitmap header. This value MUST be in the DIBColors enumeration

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.OffBmiSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the source bitmap header in the BitmapBuffer field

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.CbBmiSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the source bitmap header.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.OffBitsSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the source bitmap bits in the BitmapBuffer field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.CbBitsSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the source bitmap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.XMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the mask bitmap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.YMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the mask bitmap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.UsageMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies how to interpret values in the color table in the mask bitmap header. This value MUST be in the DIBColors enumeration.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.OffBmiMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the header of the mask bitmap in the BitmapBuffer field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.CbBmiMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the mask bitmap header.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.OffBitsMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the mask bitmap bits in the BitmapBuffer field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.CbBitsMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the mask bitmap bits

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.SourceBitmap
member.summary: Gets or sets a buffer containing the source bitmap, which are not required to be contiguous with the fixed portion of the EMR_PLGBLT record or with each other. Accordingly, fields in this buffer that are labeled "UndefinedSpace" are optional and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPlgBlt.MaskBitmap
member.summary: Gets or sets a buffer containing the mask bitmap, which are not required to be contiguous with the fixed portion of the EMR_PLGBLT record or with each other. Accordingly, fields in this buffer that are labeled "UndefinedSpace" are optional and MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier
member.summary: The EMR_POLYBEZIER record specifies one or more Bezier curves.
member.remarks: Cubic Bezier curves are defined using the endpoints and control points specified by the aPoints field. The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point, using the second and third points as control points. Each subsequent curve in the sequence needs exactly three more points: the ending point of the previous curve is used as the starting point, the next two points in the sequence are control points, and the third is the ending point. The cubic Bezier curves SHOULD be drawn using the current pen

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a 128-bit WMF RectL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19) that specifies the bounding rectangle in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of points in the aPoints array. This value MUST be one more than three times the number of curves to be drawn, because each Bezier curve requires two control points and an endpoint, and the initial curve requires an additional starting point.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier.APoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a Count length array of WMF PointL objects ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.15) that specifies the endpoints and control points of the Bezier curves, in logical units.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier16
member.summary: The EMR_POLYBEZIER16 record specifies one or more Bezier curves. The curves are drawn using the current pen.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier16.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier16.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a 128-bit WMF RectL object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19, which specifies the bounding rectangle, in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier16.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the total number of points. This value MUST be one more than three times the number of curves to be drawn, because each Bezier curve requires two control points and an endpoint, and the initial curve requires an additional starting point

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezier16.APoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a Count length array of WMF PointS objects, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.16, which specifies the array of points.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo
member.summary: The EMR_POLYBEZIERTO record specifies one or more Bezier curves based upon the current position.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a 128-bit WMF RectL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19) that specifies the bounding rectangle, in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of points in the aPoints array. The first curve MUST be drawn from the current position to the third point by using the first two points as control points. For each subsequent curve, exactly three more points MUST be specified, and the ending point of the previous curve MUST be used as the starting point for the next.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo.APoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a Count length array of WMF PointL objects ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.15) that specifies the endpoints and control points of the Bezier curves in logical units.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo16
member.summary: The EMR_POLYBEZIERTO16 record specifies one or more Bezier curves based on the current position.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 128-bit WMF RectL object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19, which specifies the bounding rectangle, in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo16.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the total number of points. The first curve is drawn from the current position to the third point by using the first two points as control points. For each subsequent curve, three more points MUST be specified, and the ending point of the previous curve MUST be used as the starting point for the next.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyBezierTo16.APoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a Count length array of WMF PointS objects, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.16, which specifies the array of points

member.summary: The EMR_POLYDRAW16 record specifies a set of line segments and Bezier curves.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolygon
member.summary: The EMR_POLYGON record specifies a polygon consisting of two or more vertexes connected by straight lines.
member.remarks: The polygon SHOULD be outlined using the current pen and filled using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon SHOULD be closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolygon16
member.summary: The EMR_POLYGON16 record specifies a polygon consisting of two or more vertexes connected by straight lines. The polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon is closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first.
member.remarks: The polygon SHOULD be outlined using the current pen and filled using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon SHOULD be closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyLineTo16
member.summary: The EMR_POLYLINETO16 record specifies one or more straight lines based upon the current position. A line is drawn from the current position to the first point specified by the aPoints field by using the current pen. For each additional line, drawing is performed from the ending point of the previous line to the next point specified by aPoints.

member.remarks: Each polygon SHOULD be outlined using the current pen, and filled using the current brush and polygon fill mode that are defined in the playback device context. The polygons defined by this record can overlap.

member.summary: The EMR_POLYPOLYLINE record specifies multiple series of connected line segments.
member.remarks: The line segments SHOULD be drawn using the current pen. The figures formed by the segments SHOULD NOT filled. The current position SHOULD neither be used nor updated by this record.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA
member.summary: The EMR_POLYTEXTOUTA record draws one or more ASCII text strings using the current font and text colors.
member.remarks: The font and text colors used for output are specified by properties in the current state of the playback device context. EMR_POLYTEXTOUTA SHOULD be emulated with a series of EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records (section 2.3.5.7), one per string. This requires the ASCII text string in each EmrText object to be converted to Unicode UTF16-LE encoding.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF RectL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19), which specifies the bounding rectangle in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.IGraphicsMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the current graphics mode, from the GraphicsMode enumeration (section 2.1.16).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.ExScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit floating-point value that specifies the X scale from page units to .01mm units if graphics mode is GM_COMPATIBLE.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.EyScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit floating-point value that specifies the Y scale from page units to .01mm units if graphics mode is GM_COMPATIBLE.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.CStrings
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of EmrText objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutA.AEmrText
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of EmrText objects (section 2.2.5) that specify the output strings in 8-bit ASCII characters, with text attributes, and spacing values. The number of EmrText objects is specified by cStrings.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfPolyTextOutW
member.summary: The EMR_POLYTEXTOUTW record draws one or more Unicode text strings using the current font and text colors.
member.remarks: The font and text colors used for output are specified by properties in the current state of the playback device context. EMR_POLYTEXTOUTW SHOULD be emulated with a series of EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records (section 2.3.5.7), one per string.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the current graphics mode, from the GraphicsMode enumeration (section 2.1.16).

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit floating-point value that specifies the X scale from page units to .01mm units if graphics mode is GM_COMPATIBLE.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRealizePalette
member.summary: This record maps palette entries from the current LogPalette object (section 2.2.17) to the system_palette. This EMF record specifies no parameters.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRealizePalette.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRectangle
member.summary: The EMR_RECTANGLE record draws a rectangle. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.
member.remarks: The current position is neither used nor updated by Rectangle. If a PS_NULL pen is used, the dimensions of the rectangle are 1 pixel less in height and 1 pixel less in width.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRectangle.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRectangle.Box
member.summary: Gets or sets a 128-bit WMF RectL object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19, which specifies the inclusive-inclusive rectangle to draw.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfResizePalette
member.summary: The EMR_RESIZEPALETTE record increases or decreases the size of an existing LogPalette object (section 2.2.17).
member.remarks: The new size of the LogPalette object MUST be reflected in the NumberOfEntries field in that structure.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfResizePalette.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfResizePalette.IhPal
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the index of the palette object in the EMF Object Table (section 3.1.1.1).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRestoreDc
member.summary: The EMR_RESTOREDC record restores the playback device context to the specified state. The playback device context is restored by popping state information off a stack that was created by prior EMR_SAVEDC records (section 2.3.11).
member.remarks: The stack can contain state information for multiple instances of the playback device context. When a state is restored, all state instances that were saved more recently MUST be discarded.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRestoreDc.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRestoreDc.SavedDc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the saved state to restore relative to the current state. This value MUST be negative; 1 represents the state that was most recently saved on the stack, 2 the one before that, etc.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRop4
member.summary: A quaternary raster operation, which specifies ternary raster operations for the foreground and background colors of a bitmap. These values define how the color data of the source rectangle is to be combined with the color data of the destination rectangle.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRop4.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRop4.Reserved
member.summary: Gets the reserved. This field SHOULD be 0x0000 and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRop4.BackgroundRop3
member.summary: Gets the background ROP3. The unsigned, most-significant 8 bits of a 24-bit ternary raster operation value from the WMF Ternary Raster Operation enumeration ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.31). This code defines how to combine the background color data of the source and destination bitmaps and brush pattern.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRop4.ForegroundRop3
member.summary: Gets the foreground ROP3. The unsigned, most-significant 8 bits of a 24-bit ternary raster operation value from the WMF Ternary Raster Operation enumeration. This code defines how to combine the foreground color data of the source and destination bitmaps and brush pattern.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRoundRect
member.summary: The EMR_ROUNDRECT record specifies a rectangle with rounded corners. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRoundRect.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRoundRect.Box
member.summary: Gets or sets a 128-bit WMF RectL object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19, which specifies the inclusive-inclusive rectangle to draw.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRoundRect.Corner
member.summary: Gets or sets a 64-bit WMF SizeL object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.22, which specifies the width and height, in logical coordinates, of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSaveDc
member.summary: Saves the current state of playback device context on a stack of states saved by preceding EMR_SAVEDC records, if any. The state consists of graphics properties and objects, including the currently selected bitmap, brush, palette, font, pen, and region. An EMR_RESTOREDC record is used to restore the state. This EMF record specifies no parameters.
member.remarks: The stack can contain state information for multiple instances of the playback device context. When a state is restored, all state instances that were saved more recently MUST be discarded.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSaveDc.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleViewportExtex
member.summary: The EMR_SCALEVIEWPORTEXTEX record respecifies the viewport for a device context by using the ratios formed by the specified multiplicands and divisors.
member.remarks: The extent cannot be changed if the device context is using a fixed scale mapping mode. Only MM_ISOTROPIC and MM_ANISOTROPIC are not fixed scale. The viewport extents are modified as follows. xNewWE = (xOldWE * xNum) / xDenom yNewWE = (yOldWE * yNum) / yDenom

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleViewportExtex.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleViewportExtex.XNum
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the horizontal multiplicand. Cannot be zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleViewportExtex.XDenom
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the horizontal divisor. Cannot be zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleViewportExtex.YNum
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the vertical multiplicand. Cannot be zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleViewportExtex.YDenom
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the vertical divisor. Cannot be zero.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleWindowExtex
member.summary: The EMR_SCALEWINDOWEXTEX record respecifies the window for a playback device context by using the ratios formed by the specified multiplicands and divisors.
member.remarks: The extent cannot be changed if the device context is using a fixed scale mapping mode. Only MM_ISOTROPIC and MM_ANISOTROPIC are not fixed scale. The window extents are modified as follows. xNewWE = (xOldWE * xNum) / xDenom yNewWE = (yOldWE * yNum) / yDenom

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleWindowExtex.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleWindowExtex.XNum
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the horizontal multiplicand. MUST NOT be zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleWindowExtex.XDenom
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the horizontal divisor. MUST NOT be zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleWindowExtex.YNum
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the vertical multiplicand. MUST NOT be zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfScaleWindowExtex.YDenom
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the vertical divisor. MUST NOT be zero.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectClipPath
member.summary: The EMR_SELECTCLIPPATH record specifies the current path as a clipping region for a playback device context, combining the new region with any existing clipping region using the specified mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectClipPath.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectClipPath.RegionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the way to use the path. The value MUST be in the RegionMode enumeration (section 2.1.29).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectObject
member.summary: The EMR_SELECTOBJECT record adds a graphics object to the current metafile playback device context. The object is specified either by its index in the EMF Object Table(section 3.1.1.1) or by its value from the StockObject enumeration(section 2.1.31).

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectObject.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectObject.ObjectHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies either the index of a graphics object in the EMF Object Table or the index of a stock object from the enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectPalette
member.summary: The EMR_SELECTPALETTE record specifies a logical palette for the playback device context.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectPalette.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSelectPalette.IhPal
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies either the index of a LogPalette object (section 2.2.17) in the EMF Object Table or the value DEFAULT_PALETTE, which is the index of a stock object palette from the StockObject enumeration (section 2.1.31).
member.remarks: This value MUST NOT be zero or the index of any other stock object.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetArcDirection
member.summary: The EMR_SETARCDIRECTION record specifies the drawing direction to be used for arc and rectangle output.
member.remarks: The EMR_SETARCDIRECTION record affects the direction in which the following records draw: - EMR_ARC (section 2.3.5.2) - EMR_ARCTO (section 2.3.5.3) - EMR_CHORD (section 2.3.5.4) - EMR_ELLIPSE (section 2.3.5.5) - EMR_PIE (section 2.3.5.15) - EMR_RECTANGLE (section 2.3.5.34) - EMR_ROUNDRECT (section 2.3.5.35)

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetArcDirection.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetArcDirection.ArcDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the arc direction. The value MUST be in the ArcDirection enumeration (section 2.1.2). The default direction is counterclockwise.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBkColor
member.summary: The EMR_SETBKCOLOR record specifies the background color.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBkColor.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBkColor.Argb32Color
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit WMF ColorRef object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8, which specifies the background color value.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBkMode
member.summary: The EMR_SETBKMODE record specifies the background mix mode of the playback device context. The background mix mode is used with text, hatched brushes, and pen styles that are not solid lines.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBkMode.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBkMode.BackgroundMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the background mode and MUST be in the BackgroundMode (section 2.1.4) enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBrushOrgEx
member.summary: The EMR_SETBRUSHORGEX record specifies the origin of the current brush.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBrushOrgEx.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetBrushOrgEx.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets a 64-bit WMF PointL object, specified in [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.15, which specifies the brush's horizontal and vertical origin in device units.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetColorAdjustment
member.summary: The EMR_SETCOLORADJUSTMENT record specifies color adjustment properties in the playback device context.
member.remarks: Color adjustment values are used to adjust the input color of the source bitmap for graphics operations performed by EMR_STRETCHBLT and EMR_STRETCHDIBITS records when STRETCH_HALFTONE mode is set from the StretchMode enumeration (section 2.1.32). The ColorAdjustment object specified by this record MUST be used in graphics operations that require a ColorAdjustment object, until a different ColorAdjustment object is specified by another EMR_SETCOLORADJUSTMENT record, or until the object is removed by a EMR_DELETEOBJECT record.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetColorAdjustment.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetColorAdjustment.ColorAdjustment
member.summary: Gets or sets a ColorAdjustment object (section 2.2.2) that specifies color adjustment values.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetColorSpace
member.summary: The EMR_SETCOLORSPACE record defines the current logical color space object for graphics operations.
member.remarks: The logical color space object defined by this record MUST be used in drawing operations that are specified by subsequent EMF records, until either a different logical color space object is specified by another EMR_SETCOLORSPACE record, or the object is removed by a EMR_DELETECOLORSPACE record.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetColorSpace.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetColorSpace.IhCS
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the index of a logical color space object in the EMF Object Table (section 3.1.1.1).
member.remarks: This object is either a WMF LogColorSpace or LogColorSpaceW object ([MS-WMF] sections 2.2.2.11 and 2.2.2.12, respectively).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetDiBitsToDevice
member.summary: The EMR_SETDIBITSTODEVICE record specifies a block transfer of pixels from specified scan lines of a source bitmap to a destination rectangle.
member.remarks: This record supports source images in JPEG and PNG format. The Compression field in the source bitmap header specifies the image format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetDiBitsToDevice.CySrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the height in pixels of the source rectangle

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the source bitmap header in the BitmapBuffer field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetDiBitsToDevice.CbBmiSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the source bitmap header.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetDiBitsToDevice.OffBitsSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the source bitmap bits in the BitmapBuffer field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetDiBitsToDevice.CbBitsSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the source bitmap bits.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetDiBitsToDevice.UsageSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies how to interpret values in the color table in the source bitmap header. This value MUST be in the DIBColors enumeration (section 2.1.9).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetIcmMode
member.summary: The EMR_SETICMMODE record specifies the mode of Image Color Management (ICM) for graphics operations.
member.remarks: When ICM mode is enabled, colors specified in EMF records SHOULD be color matched, whereas the default color profile in the playback device context SHOULD be used when a bit-block transfer is performed. If the default color profile is not desired, ICM mode SHOULD be turned off before performing the bit-block transfer.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies whether to enable or disable ICM, from the ICMMode enumeration (section 2.1.18). This value is part of the state of the playback device context.

member.summary: Gets the name

member.summary: Sets the default horizontal layout to be right-to-left. This mode is required for some languages, including Arabic and Hebrew.

member.summary: Disables mirroring of bitmaps that are drawn by Bitmap Record Types (section 2.3.1), when the layout mode is right-to-left.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer specifying the number of UFIs to follow.

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of uNumLinkedUFI elements of type UniversalFontId, which specifies the identifiers of the linked fonts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetLinkedUfis.Reserved
member.summary: Gets or sets this field is reserved and MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetMapMode
member.summary: The EMR_SETMAPMODE record specifies the mapping mode of the playback device context. The mapping mode specifies the unit of measure used to transform page space units into device space units, and also specifies the orientation of the device's x-axis and y-axis.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetMapMode.MapMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the map mode.

member.summary: The EMR_SETMAPPERFLAGS record specifies parameters of the process of matching logical fonts to physical fonts, which is performed by the font mapper.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetMapperFlags.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetMapperFlags.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies parameters of the font matching process.
member.remarks: 0x00000001 The font mapper SHOULD select only fonts that match the aspect ratio of the output device, as it is currently defined in the playback device context.

member.summary: Inter sets the current meta region with the current clipping region to form a new meta region for the playback device context. The current clipping region SHOULD be reset to null. This EMF record specifies no parameters.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetMetaRgn.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: The EMR_SETMITERLIMIT record specifies the limit for the length of miter joins for the playback device context.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetMiterLimit.MiterLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the new miter length limit.

member.summary: The EMR_SETPALETTEENTRIES record defines RGB color values in a range of entries for an existing LogPalette (section 2.2.17) object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPaletteEntries.IhPal
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the palette EMF Object Table index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPaletteEntries.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the index of the first entry to set.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPaletteEntries.NumberofEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of entries.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPaletteEntries.Argb32PalEntries

member.summary: The EMR_SETPIXELV record defines the color of the pixel at the specified logical coordinates.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPixelV.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPixelV.Argb32Color
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit WMF ColorRef object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8) that specifies the pixel color.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPolyFillMode
member.summary: The EMR_SETPOLYFILLMODE record defines polygon fill mode.
member.remarks: In general, the modes differ only in cases where a complex, overlapping polygon MUST be filled; for example, a five-sided polygon that forms a five-pointed star with a pentagon in the center. In such cases, ALTERNATE mode SHOULD fill every other enclosed region within the polygon (the points of the star), but WINDING mode SHOULD fill all regions (the points of the star and the pentagon). When the fill mode is ALTERNATE, the area between odd-numbered and even-numbered polygon sides on each scan line SHOULD be filled. That is, the area between the first and second side SHOULD be filled, and between the third and fourth side, and so on. When the fill mode is WINDING, any region that has a nonzero winding value SHOULD be filled. The winding value is the number of times a pen used to draw the polygon would go around the region. The direction of each edge of the polygon is significant.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPolyFillMode.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetPolyFillMode.PolygonFillMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the polygon fill mode and MUST be in the PolygonFillMode (section 2.1.27) enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetRop2
member.summary: The EMR_SETROP2 record defines a binary raster operation mode.
member.remarks: Binary raster operation mix modes define how to combine source and destination colors when drawing with the current pen. The mix modes are binary raster operation codes, representing all possible Boolean functions of two variables, using the binary operations AND, OR, and XOR (exclusive OR), and the unary operation NOT. The mix mode is for raster devices only; it is not available for vector devices.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetRop2.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetRop2.Rop2Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the raster operation mode and MUST be in the WMF Binary Raster Op enumeration ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.2).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetStrechBltMode
member.summary: The EMR_SETSTRETCHBLTMODE record specifies bitmap stretch mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetStrechBltMode.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetStrechBltMode.StretchMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the stretch mode and MAY be in the StretchMode enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetTextAlign
member.summary: The EMR_SETTEXTALIGN record specifies text alignment.
member.remarks: The EMR_SMALLTEXTOUT, EMR_EXTTEXTOUTA, and EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records use text alignment values to position a string of text on the output medium. The values specify the relationship between a reference point and a rectangle that bounds the text. The reference point is either the current position or a point passed to a text output record. The rectangle that bounds the text is formed by the character cells in the text string.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetTextAlign.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetTextAlign.TextAlignmentMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies text alignment by using a mask of text alignment flags. These are either ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.2.3) for text with a horizontal baseline, or ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.2.4) for text with a vertical baseline. Only one value can be chosen from those that affect horizontal and vertical alignment.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetTextColor
member.summary: The EMR_SETTEXTCOLOR record defines the current text color.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetTextJustification
member.summary: The EMR_SETTEXTJUSTIFICATION record specifies the amount of extra space to add to break characters for text justification.
member.remarks: Instead of using an EMR_SETTEXTJUSTIFICATION record, an implementation SHOULD use an EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW record (section 2.3.5.8) to perform this function.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSetTextJustification.NBreakCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the number of break characters.

member.summary: The EMR_SETWORLDTRANSFORM record specifies a transform for the current world-space to page space transform in the playback device context.
member.remarks: For more information concerning transforms and coordinate spaces, see [MSDN-WRLDPGSPC]. See section 2.3.12 for the specification of other transform record types.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSmallTextOut
member.summary: The EMR_SMALLTEXTOUT record outputs a string.
member.remarks: If ETO_SMALL_CHARS is set in the fuOptions field, TextString contains 8-bit codes for characters, derived from the low bytes of 16-bit Unicode UTF16-LE character codes, in which the high byte is assumed to be 0. If ETO_NO_RECT is set in the fuOptions field, the Bounds field is not included in the record.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer specifying the x-coordinate of where to place the string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSmallTextOut.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer specifying the y-coordinate of where to place the string.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer specifying the number of 16-bit characters in the string. The string is NOT null-terminated.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer specifying the text output options to use. These options are specified by one or a combination of values from the ExtTextOutOptions enumeration (section 2.1.11).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSmallTextOut.IGraphicsMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer specifying the graphics mode, from the GraphicsMode enumeration (section 2.1.16).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSmallTextOut.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional, 128-bit WMF RectL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19) that specifies the bounding rectangle in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfSmallTextOut.TextString
member.summary: Gets or sets a variable-length string that contains the text string to draw, in either 8-bit or 16-bit character codes, according to the value of the fuOptions field.

member.summary: The EMR_STRETCHBLT record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfStretchBlt.CyDest

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfStretchBlt.BitBltRasterOperation
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the raster operation code. This code defines how the color data of the source rectangle is to be combined with the color data of the destination rectangle and optionally a brush pattern, to achieve the final color

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies how to interpret values in the color table in the source bitmap header. This value MUST be in the DIBColors enumeration (section 2.1.9).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfStretchBlt.OffBmiSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the source bitmap header.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset, in bytes, from the start of this record to the source bitmap bits.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the source bitmap bits.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical width of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfStretchBlt.CySrc
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical height of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfStretchBlt.SourceBitmap
member.summary: Gets or sets a buffer containing the source bitmap, which is not required to be contiguous with the fixed portion of the EMR_STRETCHBLT record. Accordingly, fields in this buffer that are labeled "UndefinedSpace" are optional and MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfStretchDiBits
member.summary: The EMR_STRETCHDIBITS record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary.
member.remarks: This record supports source images in JPEG and PNG formats. The Compression field in the source bitmap header specifies the image format. If the signs of the source and destination height and width fields differ, this record specifies a mirror-image copy of the source bitmap to the destination. That is, if cxSrc and cxDest have different signs, a mirror image of the source bitmap along the x-axis is specified. If cySrc and cyDest have different signs, a mirror image of the source bitmap along the y-axis is specified.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the y-coordinate in pixels of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of nTri GradientRectangle objects (section 2.2.7) or GradientTriangle objects (section 2.2.8), depending on the value of the ulMode field. Each object specifies indexes into the array of TriVertex objects in the VertexObjects field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Records.EmfVertexData.VertexPadding
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional variable-length array of nTri times four bytes that MUST be present if the value of the ulMode field indicates GradientRectangle objects (section 2.2.7). If the value of the ulMode field indicates GradientTriangle objects (section 2.2.8), no VertexPadding is present. This field MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation
member.summary: The BinaryRasterOperation Enumeration section lists the binary raster-operation codes. Raster operation codes define how metafile processing combines the bits from the selected pen with the bits in the destination bitmap.
member.remarks: Each raster-operation code represents a Boolean operation in which the values of the pixels in the selected pen and the destination bitmap are combined. Following are the two operands used in these operations. Operand Meaning P Selected pen D Destination bitmap a Bitwise AND n Bitwise NOT (inverse) o Bitwise OR x Bitwise exclusive OR (XOR)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_BLACK
member.summary: 0, Pixel is always 0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_NOTMERGEPEN
member.summary: DPon, Pixel is the inverse of the R2_MERGEPEN color

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_MASKNOTPEN
member.summary: DPna, Pixel is a combination of the screen color and the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_NOTCOPYPEN
member.summary: Pn, Pixel is the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_MASKPENNOT
member.summary: PDna, Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the screen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_NOT
member.summary: Dn, Pixel is the inverse of the screen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_XORPEN
member.summary: DPx, Pixel is a combination of the colors in the pen or in the screen, but not in both.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_NOTMASKPEN
member.summary: DPan, Pixel is the inverse of the R2_MASKPEN color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_MASKPEN
member.summary: DPa, Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the screen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_NOTXORPEN
member.summary: DPxn, Pixel is the inverse of the R2_XORPEN color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_NOP
member.summary: D, Pixel remains unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_MERGENOTPEN
member.summary: DPno, Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the screen and the inverse of the pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_COPYPEN
member.summary: P, Pixel is the pen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_MERGEPENNOT
member.summary: PDno, Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the screen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_MERGEPEN
member.summary: DPo, Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the screen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.R2_WHITE
member.summary: 1, Pixel is always 1

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount
member.summary: The BitCount Enumeration specifies the number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_0
member.summary: The number of bits per pixel is undefined. The image SHOULD be in either JPEG or PNG format. Neither of these formats includes a color table, so this value specifies that no color table is present. See [JFIF] and [RFC2083] for more information concerning JPEG and PNG compression formats.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_1
member.summary: The image is specified with two colors.Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a single bit. If the bit is clear, the pixel is displayed with the color of the first entry in the color table; if the bit is set, the pixel has the color of the second entry in the table.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_2
member.summary: The image is specified with a maximum of 16 colors. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a 4-bit index into the color table, and each byte contains 2 pixels.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_3
member.summary: The image is specified with a maximum of 256 colors. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by an 8-bit index into the color table, and each byte contains 1 pixel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_4
member.summary: The image is specified with a maximum of 2^16 colors. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a 16-bit value

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_5
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^24 colors, and the Colors field of DIB is NULL. Each 3-byte triplet in the bitmap array represents the relative intensities of blue, green, and red, respectively, for a pixel. The Colors color table is used for optimizing colors used on palette-based devices, and MUST contain the number of entries specified by the ColorUsed field of the BitmapInfoHeader Object

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_6
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^24 colors

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle
member.summary: The BrushStyle Enumeration specifies the different possible brush types that can be used in graphics operations. For more information, see the specification of the Brush Object (section 2.2.1.1).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_SOLID
member.summary: A brush that paints a single, constant color, either solid or dithered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_NULL
member.summary: A brush that does nothing. Using a BS_NULL brush in a graphics operation MUST have the same effect as using no brush at all

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_HATCHED
member.summary: A brush that paints a predefined simple pattern, or "hatch", onto a solid background

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_PATTERN
member.summary: A brush that paints a pattern defined by a bitmap, which MAY be a Bitmap16 Object or a DeviceIndependentBitmap (DIB) Object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_INDEXED
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_DIBPATTERN
member.summary: A pattern brush specified by a DIB.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_DIBPATTERNPT
member.summary: A pattern brush specified by a DIB.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_PATTERN8X8
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_DIBPATTERN8X8
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.BS_MONOPATTERN
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet
member.summary: The CharacterSet Enumeration defines the possible sets of character glyphs that are defined in fonts for graphics output.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.ANSI_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the English character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.DEFAULT_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies a character set based on the current system locale; for example, when the system locale is United States English, the default character set is ANSI_CHARSET.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.SYMBOL_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies a character set of symbols.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.MAC_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Apple Macintosh character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.SHIFTJIS_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Japanese character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.HANGUL_CHARSET
member.summary: Also spelled "Hangeul". Specifies the Hangul Korean character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.JOHAB_CHARSET
member.summary: Also spelled "Johap". Specifies the Johab Korean character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.GB2312_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the "simplified" Chinese character set for People's Republic of China.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.CHINESEBIG5_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the "traditional" Chinese character set, used mostly in Taiwan and in the Hong Kong and Macao Special Administrative Regions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.GREEK_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Greek character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.TURKISH_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Turkish character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.VIETNAMESE_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Vietnamese character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.HEBREW_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Vietnamese character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.ARABIC_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Arabic character set

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.BALTIC_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Baltic (Northeastern European) character set

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.RUSSIAN_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Russian Cyrillic character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.THAI_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies the Thai character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.EASTEUROPE_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies a Eastern European character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.OEM_CHARSET
member.summary: Specifies a mapping to one of the OEM code pages, according to the current system locale setting.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags
member.summary: ClipPrecision Flags specify clipping precision, which defines how to clip characters that are partially outside a clipping region. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS
member.summary: Specifies that default clipping MUST be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_CHARACTER_PRECIS
member.summary: This value SHOULD NOT be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_STROKE_PRECIS
member.summary: This value MAY be returned when enumerating rasterized, TrueType and vector fonts. [33] (Windows NT 3.1, Windows NT 3.5, Windows NT 3.51, Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000, and Windows XP: This value is always returned when enumerating fonts.)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_LH_ANGLES
member.summary: This value is used to control font rotation, as follows: - If set, the rotation for all fonts SHOULD be determined by the orientation of the coordinate system; that is, whether the orientation is left-handed or right-handed. - If clear, device fonts SHOULD rotate counterclockwise, but the rotation of other fonts SHOULD be determined by the orientation of the coordinate system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_TT_ALWAYS
member.summary: This value SHOULD NOT [34] be used. [34] This value is ignored in the following Windows versions: - Windows Vista - Windows Server 2008 - Windows 7 - Windows Server 2008 R2 - Windows 8 - Windows Server 2012 - Windows 8.1 - Windows Server 2012 R2

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_DFA_DISABLE
member.summary: This value specifies that font association SHOULD [35] be turned off. [35] This value is not supported.in Windows 95, Windows 98, and Windows Millennium Edition. Font association is turned off in Windows 2000, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003. This value is ignored in these Windows versions: - Windows Vista - Windows Server 2008 - Windows 7 - Windows Server 2008 R2 - Windows 8 - Windows Server 2012 - Windows 8.1 - Windows Server 2012 R2

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.CLIP_EMBEDDED
member.summary: This value specifies that font embedding MUST be used to render document content; embedded fonts are read-only.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum
member.summary: The ColorUsage Enumeration specifies whether a color table exists in a device-independent bitmap(DIB) and how to interpret its values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum.DIB_RGB_COLORS
member.summary: The color table contains RGB values specified by RGBQuad Objects (section 2.2.2.20).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum.DIB_PAL_COLORS
member.summary: The color table contains 16-bit indices into the current logical palette in the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum.DIB_PAL_INDICES
member.summary: No color table exists. The pixels in the DIB are indices into the current logical palette in the playback device context.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression
member.summary: The Compression Enumeration specifies the type of compression for a bitmap image

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_RGB
member.summary: The bitmap is in uncompressed red green blue (RGB) format that is not compressed and does not use color masks.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_RLE8
member.summary: An RGB format that uses run-length encoding (RLE) compression for bitmaps with 8 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by a byte containing a color index.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_RLE4
member.summary: An RGB format that uses RLE compression for bitmaps with 4 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by two word-length color indexes

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_BITFIELDS
member.summary: The bitmap is not compressed and the color table consists of three DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, and blue components, respectively, of each pixel. This is valid when used with 16 and 32-bits per pixel bitmaps.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_JPEG
member.summary: The image is a JPEG image, as specified in [JFIF]. This value SHOULD only be used in certain bitmap operations, such as JPEG pass-through. The application MUST query for the pass-through support, since not all devices support JPEG pass-through. Using non-RGB bitmaps MAY limit the portability of the metafile to other devices. For instance, display device contexts generally do not support this pass-through

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_PNG
member.summary: The image is a PNG image, as specified in [RFC2083]. This value SHOULD only be used certain bitmap operations, such as JPEG/PNG pass-through. The application MUST query for the pass-through support, because not all devices support JPEG/PNG pass-through. Using non-RGB bitmaps MAY limit the portability of the metafile to other devices. For instance, display device contexts generally do not support this pass-through.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_CMYK
member.summary: The image is an uncompressed CMYK format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_CMYKRLE8
member.summary: A CMYK format that uses RLE compression for bitmaps with 8 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by a byte containing a color index.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_CMYKRLE4
member.summary: A CMYK format that uses RLE compression for bitmaps with 4 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by two word-length color indexes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont
member.summary: The FamilyFont enumeration specifies the font family. Font families describe the look of a font in a general way. They are intended for specifying fonts when the exact typeface desired is not available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.FF_DONTCARE
member.summary: The default font is specified, which is implementation-dependent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.FF_ROMAN
member.summary: Fonts with variable stroke widths, which are proportional to the actual widths of the glyphs, and which have serifs. "MS Serif" is an example.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.FF_SWISS
member.summary: Fonts with variable stroke widths, which are proportional to the actual widths of the glyphs, and which do not have serifs. "MS Sans Serif" is an example.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.FF_MODERN
member.summary: Fonts with constant stroke width, with or without serifs. Fixed-width fonts are usually modern. "Pica", "Elite", and "Courier New" are examples.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.FF_SCRIPT
member.summary: Fonts designed to look like handwriting. "Script" and "Cursive" are examples.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.FF_DECORATIVE
member.summary: Novelty fonts. "Old English" is an example.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality
member.summary: The FontQuality Enumeration specifies how closely the attributes of the logical font should match those of the physical font when rendering text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.DEFAULT_QUALITY
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font does not matter, so DRAFT_QUALITY can be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.DRAFT_QUALITY
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font is less important than the matching of logical attribuetes. For rasterized fonts, scaling SHOULD be enabled, which means that more font sizes are available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.PROOF_QUALITY
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font is more important than the matching of logical attributes. For rasterized fonts, scaling SHOULD be disabled, and the font closest in size SHOULD be chosen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY
member.summary: Specifies that anti-aliasing SHOULD NOT be used when rendering text

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent
member.summary: The GamutMappingIntent Enumeration specifies the relationship between logical and physical colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_ABS_COLORIMETRIC
member.summary: Specifies that the white point SHOULD be maintained. Typically used when logical colors MUST be matched to their nearest physical color in the destination color gamut. Intent: Match ICC name: Absolute Colorimetric

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_BUSINESS
member.summary: Specifies that saturation SHOULD be maintained. Typically used for business charts and other situations in which dithering is not required. Intent: Graphic ICC name: Saturation

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_GRAPHICS
member.summary: Specifies that a colorimetric match SHOULD be maintained. Typically used for graphic designs and named colors. Intent: Proof ICC name: Relative Colorimetric

member.summary: Specifies that contrast SHOULD be maintained. Typically used for photographs and natural images. Intent: Picture ICC name: Perceptual

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfLogicalColorSpaceEnum

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Wmf.Consts.WmfLogicalColorSpaceEnum.LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB
